post.html:
If you look up how to write a map or a list out as a string, you can find lots of complicated answers involving loops and even XMLEncoders. It doesn’t have to be that hard. The easiest way to convert a Map into a nice string?

String niceString = Arrays.toString(map.entrySet().toArray());

It’s even easier for a list:

String niceString = Arrays.toString(list.toArray());

Ta-daaa!
post.excerpt: If you look up how to write a map or a list out as a string, you can find lots of complicated answers involving loops and even XMLEncoders…

fields.title: Java basics: converting a collection to a string
fields.author: holly cummins

authornote.html: Holly Cummins. Holly Cummins is a Senior Principal Software Engineer at Red Hat, in the Quarkus Team. She is a keynote speaker, author, and bad illustrator.

frontmatter.title: Everything I know about software, I learnt from spaghetti bolognese
